Quick search

Aqua Finance¶

Qiskit Aqua Finance is a set of tools and algorithms that enable experimenting with financial analysis and optimization problems via quantum computing. Aqua Finance is the only end-to-end software stack that translates finance-specific problems into inputs for one of the Quantum Algorithms in Aqua: A Library of Quantum Algorithms, which in turn uses Qiskit Terra for the actual quantum computation on top a quantum simulator or a real quantum hardware device.

Aqua Finance allows users with different levels of experience to execute financial analysis and optimization experiments and contribute to the quantum computing finance software stack. Users with a pure finance background or interests can continue to configure financial analysis and optimization problems without having to learn the details of the underlying quantum computing system.

Aqua Finance Problems¶

Aqua Finance can already be used to experiment with financial analysis and optimization problems, such as risk analysis and portfolio optimization.

Contributing to Aqua Finance¶

Research and developers interested in Contributing to Aqua with new finance-specific capabilities can take advantage of the modular architecture of Aqua and easily extend Aqua with more algorithms and algorithm components, such as new Oracles for the Quantum Grover Search algorithm, Optimizers and Variational Forms for Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE), Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm (QAOA), and Support Vector Machine Variational (QSVM Variational), Inverse Quantum Fourier Transforms for Quantum Phase Estimation (QPE), Initial States for Variational Forms, as well as Feature Maps and multiclass-extensions for Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithms, such as Support Vector Machine Variational (QSVM Variational) and Support Vector Machine Quantum Kernel (QSVM Kernel).

Examples¶

The finance folder of the Aqua Tutorials GitHub Repository contains Jupyter Notebooks and sample input data files explaining how to use Aqua Finance.
